oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Capt. Charles M. Blackford to Lt. Col. G. M. Sorrel
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from Capt. Charles M. Blackford, Judge Advocate of Longstreet's Corps, to Lt. Col. Gilbert Moxley Sorrel seeking clarification on the sentencing of Pvt. Isaac Blanton, Co. A, 51st Va. Inf. Regt. Having apparently taken leave without permission, Blanton was sentenced to "carry a fence-rail upon his shoulder four hours a day, two in the morning and two in the evening, for four months inclusive of the period of his unauthorized absence." Sorrel's response is written on the back of the letter.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee
